item.title: Vampire: The Masquerade Bloodlines 2 Sinks Its Fangs Into An October Release Date
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 will officially launch on October 21, co-publishers Paradox Interactive and White Wolf revealed during Gamescom Opening Night Live. In a new trailer, players also got a closer look at the game and how parts of the storyline will see them step into the shoes of Fabien--a mysterious Malkvian detective and the voice inside of the protagonist Phyre's mind--who'll help them unravel a murder mystery that threatens to alter Seattle's secret vampire society.

Alongside the standard release, there'll be two special editions that can be preordered. Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 Deluxe Edition comes bundled with Santa Monica Memories--a cosmetic pack featuring decor items inspired by the original Bloodlines game--to adorn Phyre's in-game apartment, and the Premium Edition includes that DLC and the DLC Shadows and Silk.

This add-on allows enables players to choose the Lasombra or Toreador clans for Phyre to join, and each one offers unique abilities, playstyles, and distinct outfits. This DLC will be available as standalone purchases for the standard edition of Bloodlines 2. Preorders will also include the Bloodlines Nostalgia Jukebox, a decor item for Phyre's haven that features a curated playlist of in-game music by the composer of the first Bloodlines game, Rik Schaffer.

Bloodlines 2 arrives during a busy time on the gaming calendar, as the month includes several other big releases like Ghost of Yotei, Battlefield 6, and The Outer Worlds 2. For patient fans, the wait has been a long one, as Bloodlines 2 has had a rocky development cycle over the years. The Chinese Room took over development from Hardsuit Labs in 2021, and at one point, it looked like Paradox was ready to pull the plug on the project.

Since then, The Chinese Room has kept fans of the series updated with regular deep-dives into various facets of Bloodlines 2, like the vampire clans that you can align Phyre with, the movers and shakers in vampire city, and the penalties for breaking the Masquerade that keeps humans blissfully unaware of the bloodsuckers around them.

item.title: Moonlighter 2 Releases In Early Access Soon, Including Game Pass On Day One
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

During Gamescom Opening Night Live, 11 Bit Studios and Digital Sun confirmed that Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault--the half-roguelike, half-shop-running-sim follow-up to the 2018 action-RPG Moonlighter--will enter early access on October 23.

A new trailer for the game debuted during ONL, which gave an updated look into both halves of Moonlighter 2's main adventure. We see the hero merchant Will setting up relics in his shop to sell to the local townspeople, followed by him setting out into a mysterious Vault in search of more relics to fill his shelves.

The early-access version of Moonlighter 2 launching in October will offer three different biomes, with each featuring unique obstacles and enemies. Over 120 relics will be available to find and sell in Will's shop--which you can customize to your liking, including display areas, prices of relics, and more.

The official announcement also says that the early-access period will include nearly 100 perks, an updated combat system, and "most" of the Moonlighter 2 story. The announcement also says that the game is "nearly complete, but a few parts of the adventure still need polishing," hence the choice to enter early access first.

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault will begin its early-access period October 23 on PC via Steam and PC Game Pass.

item.title: Indiana Jones And The Order Of Giants Looks Like The Best Of The Great Circle, And It's Coming To Nintendo Switch 2 Too
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Hot on the heels of its success in late 2024, Indiana Jones and the Order of Giants, a story expansion for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, sees the titular archeologist return to uncover the secrets buried deep below the surface of Rome. Publisher Bethesda also revealed that Indiana Jones and the Great Circle will launch on Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026.

A new gameplay trailer at Gamescom ONL showed off new puzzles and cults for Indy to contend with, along with a new serpentine friend for him to be introduced to. The Order of Giants pairs Indy with the young priest Father Ricci, who leads him to secrets hidden in Rome that pertain to Emperor Nero, the Cult of Mithras, and the promise of treasures hidden amongst a dark secret.

The gameplay looks like some of the best moments from The Great Circle, with the first-person perspective offering an intimate view of the dusty catacombs and dimly lit tombs that you'll explore, as well as a sample of some of the dangerous puzzles Indy will have to solve to uncover the truth at the center of this generational mystery.

The story DLC for MachineGames' Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is set to launch on September 4 on Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC. Catch up on all the best announcements from Gamescom ONL right here.
